original: Berggren, John Olof Sigurd, läroverksadjunkt, Trollhättan, f. 15/4/90 i Östmark, Värml. 1., av här:dom. C. J. B. o. Anna Östling. G. 30 m. Anna Bäckström. Barn: John Olof f. 30, Henry 32, Gudrun 38. — Stud :ex. i Karlstad 09, fil. mag. i Upps. 15, prov-år 20. Vik. adj. i Falun 16, förest, f.^ Torsby priv. samsk. 17-18, vik. adj. i Amål 18-19, e. lär. i Mora 19, vik. adj. i Västerås 21, e. lär. i Karlshamn 21-24, v. Sthlms komm. mellansk. .24-32, adj. i matem. o. fysik v. Trollhättans samrealsk. sed. 32.
translated: Berggren, John Olof Sigurd, high school teacher, Trollhättan, born on April 15th, 1890 in Östmark, Värmland. 1st of the family: son of county governor C. J. B. and Anna Östling. Married in 1930 to Anna Bäckström. Children: John Olof (born 1930), Henry (born 1932), Gudrun (born 1938). Studied for the teaching degree in Karlstad in 1909, graduated with a Master of Philosophy degree from Uppsala University in 1915, and had a one-year teaching probationary period in 1920. Worked as a substitute teacher in Falun in 1916, head of Torsby private school in 1917-1918, substitute teacher in Amål in 1918-1919, permanent teacher in Mora in 1919, substitute teacher in Västerås in 1921, permanent teacher in Karlshamn in 1921-1924, deputy in mathematics and physics at Trollhättan's secondary school since 1932.
